result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa A Remmen

Def in person & by Atty Nadya E. Perez-Reyes. Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State. Anticipated case would resolve in Br 1 but def missed an appearance and warrant was issued which has since been resolved. Request to adj to Br 1 again for anticipated disposition. Hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on September 24, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Atty Nadya E. Perez-Reyes appearing for Def.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Case called at 10:30 a.m.  This case was called in Br. I for projected global resolution.  Counsel has not had any contact with the defendant since the last court date and she also missed an office appointment.  Victim also appears and had sent a text to her daughter but received no response.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Court returns file to Br. 2 for hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
